channel.title: History on Cloud Nine
channel.description: Recent content in History on Cloud Nine

item.title: American Financier, by Jean Strous
item.description: J.P. Morgan: celebrated, powerfully unambiguous, oligarchicaly connected, pillar of American history. The man with the bushy furrowed brows, pudgy fat nose, and bulging adams apple. As a school boy, he was infirm, aloof, and disliked. As a business titan he had fingers in every corner of gilded America. He built the railway to the west. When Edison dumped Tesla on the street with a shovel - less a year or two of salary - Morgan signed him from his rescuers and put him back in the money.
